{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the relevant documents, the criteria used in the residency selection process, such as USMLE scores, clinical honors, and AOA membership, have been found to have correlations with objective measures of resident performance, including ABOS Part I scores and OITE scores. Additionally, AOA membership has been associated with higher subjective ratings by faculty. These findings suggest that residency selection criteria can predict performance in orthopaedic surgery residency to some extent. Therefore, the answer is A. yes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
